reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Supporting emergency RH and Primary Health Care services in Hawija, with focus on Salahiddin and Kirkuk

description.narrative:
The 2017 HNO estimates that 450,000 Iraqis will require humanitarian assistance of whom 65,000 inside Hawija district now and 16,250 women of reproductive age should be targeted by the humanitarian community. Parts of Kirkuk and Salahudin expected to receive a new wave of displacements while humanitarian actors and no access will be granted for them to the host communities as expected.
Assessments revealed the distress women and girls fall under. Those who displaced mostly lack basic items to preserve their dignity while those that remain in recently retaken areas lack food, water, and essential hygiene and dignity items. Almost all women that have been under ISIL have not accessed reproductive health services for long hence face complicated deliveries, miscarriages and other RH emergencies. Assessments show that as a result of UNFPA support, many health facilities now provide the minimum RH package in terms of medicines, supplies, trained personnel. However, the locations targeted in this proposal lack health services including RH.
Through this proposal, UNFPA will be able to meet immediate needs of newly displaced women. Service will be delivered through 2 mobile delivery units,4 static delivery rooms, 2 mobile RH clinics and 8 static RH clinics. Referral level support through upgrading 1 CEmONC (Shirkat hospital) facility and provide technical support for 3 maternities (Kirkuk General hospital, Azadi maternity and Daquq maternity department).
The RH intervention lies within the UNFPA mode of engagement for different populations by location (screening sites, urban settings, etc). All interventions based on the referral pyramid model per location and only where no other partner is providing RH services.
Additionally, the project will provide additional support to six NGOs to provide general health services, namely IMC, UIMS, WAHA, Islamic Relief, IHAO and INTERSOS. .INTERSOS will take responsibility to support the 4 PHCCs one MGC and 2 MMT for a period of 3 months in Salahidin UIMS will be covering Salahidin by four mobile medical clincs and static clinics in Ninawe, static delivery room, mobile delivery room IMC will cover static clinics in newly retaken areas Islamic Relief will cover 1 Moble delivery room, 3 MMTs, 3 static delivery rooms and 6 static RH clinics in Kirkuk Waha will be running 2delivery rooms in Salahadin IHAO will be providing CEmONC service in Al Shirkat hospital, mobile delivery room and run RH clinics in Salahidin
